title: Conversation: The Life Cycle of an El Greco Masterpiece—POSTPONED
hero_caption: El Greco (Domenico Theotokopoulos). The Assumption of the Virgin, 1577–1579. Gift of Nancy Atwood Sprague in memory of Albert Arnold Sprague.
short_description: Join Francesca Casadio, Grainger Executive Director of Conservation and Science, and conservator Frank Zuccari to discover how El Greco created The Assumption of the Virgin (1577–79) along with other extraordinary paintings. From conception to exhibition, trace the life cycle of El Greco’s masterpiece, including scientific analysis of the materials he used, how conservators care for his work more than 400 years on, and what happens behind the scenes in preparation for an exhibition.

description:
Join Francesca Casadio, Grainger Executive Director of Conservation and Science, and conservator Frank Zuccari to discover how El Greco created The Assumption of the Virgin (1577–79) along with other extraordinary paintings. From conception to exhibition, trace the life cycle of El Greco’s masterpiece, including scientific analysis of the materials he used, how conservators care for his work more than 400 years on, and what happens behind the scenes in preparation for an exhibition.
